abstract: Wall Street on 9/11: Needing to focus on something other than devastation and heartbreak, a Merrill Lynch trader says, “We weren’t going to let anyone bring us down.”
snippet: Wall Street on 9/11: Needing to focus on something other than devastation and heartbreak, a Merrill Lynch trader says, “We weren’t going to let anyone bring us down.”
lead_paragraph: Robert Moir, 42, joined Merrill Lynch in 1997. On Sept. 11, 2001, he was a business manager for NASDAQ Trading. He is now a managing director and chief operating officer of the Americas cash equity sales and trading at Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Replacing Panic With a Sense of Pride
